p: Anti means against and pyretic means feverish. Thus an antipyretic is a substance that reduces fever [ 87]. Most of the antipyretics work by inhibiting the enzyme cyclooxygenase and by reducing the levels of PGE 2 within the hypothalamus. Antipyretics cause the hypothalamus to override a prostaglandin-induced increase in temperature [ 88]. The body then works to lower the temperature, which results in a reduction in fever. The methanolic extract of Leea rubra roots reduced fever induced by yeast suggested that the plant has antipyretic effect [ 89]. The other plants of Leea genus might have potent antipyretic activity, as Leea rubra showed.
